definition: (modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
verbose or unclear in speech/rambling and indistinct
verbose or unclear in speech/rambling and indistinct
variant of 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
(Taiwan) see 嘰哩咕嚕|叽哩咕噜[ji1 li5 gu1 lu1]

sentences.english: How do you find a thing you have mislaid or forgotten?
sentences.chinese: 你如何找回你已經錯失或遺忘的東西哩？

sentences.english: He trudged20 miles through the deep snow.
sentences.chinese: 他在深雪之中跋涉了二十哩。

sentences.english: Men there are yet living who have seen him.
sentences.chinese: 見過他的人有的還活着哩。
我還以爲你想要湯姆，不想和我在一塊哩。

sentences.english: I thought I knew every weed and blade in this garden.
sentences.chinese: 我還以爲這花園裏的一草一木我都熟悉哩。

sentences.english: The rotter was not afraid of being beaten. He even said how sorry he was.
sentences.chinese: 他這賤骨頭打不怕，還要說可憐可憐哩。

sentences.english: I thought his prose style was about the level of General Eisenhower's.
sentences.chinese: 我原以爲他的文字水平並不比艾森豪威爾將軍高明哩。

sentences.english: I am interested in every character you have mentioned, more or less.
sentences.chinese: 我對你所提的每個人物或多或少都感到有興趣哩。

sentences.english: The car ran at the rate of thirty miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 那輛汽車是以每小時三十哩的速度行駛。

sentences.english: The fight is fiercest in Zhari.
sentences.chinese: 這是在咋哩地區最激烈的一次戰鬥。

sentences.english: 18—Those are halfcrowns, man, Corley corrected him.
sentences.chinese: “是幾枚半克朗硬幣哩，老兄，”科利糾正他說。

sentences.english: The forests stretch for hundreds of miles.

definition: to draw back the corners of one's mouth
baby/small child/(arch.) slave among ethnic minorities
sentence-final particle similar to 了[le5], but carrying a tone of approval
to shout/to bawl/to yell (to urge on an animal)/to hawk (one's wares)
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
